meanings.definition: A condition of the eye in which the lens loses its elasticity, typically occurring in middle and old age, resulting in difficulty focusing on close objects.
meanings.sent1: Grandma's presbyopias made it hard for her to read her favorite books.
meanings.sent2: As people get older, presbyopias can make it challenging to see things up close.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel blamed his presbyopias for mistaking a walnut for an acorn.
meanings.sent4: Time's relentless march brought presbyopias to his eyes, blurring the lines of youth.
meanings.sent5: The gradual onset of presbyopias felt like nature's way of gently nudging him towards reading glasses.

meanings.definition: The inability of the eye to focus sharply on nearby objects, resulting from loss of elasticity of the crystalline lens with advancing age.
meanings.sent1: Presbyopias can make it hard to thread a needle as you get older.
meanings.sent2: Many people experience presbyopias as they reach their golden years.
meanings.sent3: The detective jokingly blamed presbyopias for mistaking a fingerprint for a smudge of ink.
meanings.sent4: His presbyopias turned the world into a soft-focus painting, blurring the sharp edges of reality.
meanings.sent5: The artist used presbyopias as inspiration, creating a series of paintings with dreamlike blurriness.
